info.description: Torque is an object-relational mapper for java. In other words, Torque lets you access and manipulate data in a relational database using java objects. Unlike most other object-relational mappers, Torque does not use reflection to access user-provided classes, but it generates the necessary classes (including the Data Objects) from an XML schema describing the database layout (which can either be written by hand or generated from an existing database). The XML schema can also be used to generate and execute a SQL script which creates all the tables in the database. As Torque hides database-specific implementation details, Torque makes an application independent of a specific database if no exotic features of the database are used. Usage of autogeneration eases the customization of the database layer, as you can override the autogenerated methods and thus easily change their behaviour. Torque was developed as part of the Turbine Framework. It is now decoupled and can be used by itself. Starting with version 2.2 Turbine uses the decoupled Torque.
